name: Weng Santos
text: No. The constitution explicitly states that civilian authority is, at all times, supreme over the military. Hence, the president, as the head of civilian power, is installed as commander in chief.    Kahit si Ramos na heneral, he is considered a civilian president, who is also, by constitutional fiat, the commander in chief.    That is a people power provision in the constitution designed to prevent military rule and to ensure that sovereign power always resides is regular citizens.

source_obj.text: No. The constitution explicitly states that civilian authority is, at all times, supreme over the military. Hence, the president, as the head of civilian power, is installed as commander in chief.    Kahit si Ramos na heneral, he is considered a civilian president, who is also, by constitutional fiat, the commander in chief.    That is a people power provision in the constitution designed to prevent military rule and to ensure that sovereign power always resides is regular citizens.
